title: Analysing Indian States’ macro-fiscal health

title: Pak captain: 'Suryakumar shook hands privately', slams IND for disrespecting cricket
description: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha slammed India for disrespecting cricket during the Asia Cup, claiming Suryakumar Yadav shook hands in private but refused to do the same in front of the cameras. He also stated that his side posed for pictures with the trophy as they wanted to fulfill their obligations.

The Indian players celebrated with an imaginary trophy, while Suryakumar Yadav and Abhishek Sharma publicly criticised the ACC in the post-match press conference.

Michigan church shooting: 4 killed, several injured as gunman opens fire on worshippers
description: A Michigan church service turned horrific when a gunman crashed his truck, opened fire, and set the building ablaze, killing two and injuring eight. Police shot dead the attacker, Thomas Jacob Sanford, a 40-year-old former US Marine. The 10-minute rampage left the church destroyed, with authorities investigating the motive behind this shocking act of violence.

description: India's Asia Cup triumph over Pakistan was overshadowed by unprecedented drama as ACC president Mohsin Naqvi allegedly walked away with the winners' trophy. BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia confirmed India refused to accept the silverware from him, announcing a ₹21 crore cash reward for the team and vowing a strong protest at the upcoming ICC conference.

title: Fire breaks out at Tiruvannamalai GH
description: Based on an alert, a six-member firefighters team and Tiruvannamalai East police personnel rushed to the spot.

title: Clustering maize plants together can improve their insect resistance
description: In search of sustainable solutions, researchers from Zhejiang University in China in collaboration with partners from the Netherlands and Switzerland have uncovered an unexpected and powerful form of plant communication that could strengthen crop resilience. Their findings were published in Science

title: 92% UGD work completed in Vellore, says Corporation Commissioner
description: Corporation Commissioner R. Lakshmanan told The Hindu that completion of ongoing pipeline-carrying bridge across Palar river, pipe-laying work in at least five streets in Old Town area, and construction of a new pumping station at Vasanthapuram behind the fort complex are remaining works as part of the UGD system.

description: Welcoming the gathering, Ms. Agarwal said that the importance of inculcating healthy habits right from childhood is required.

Surya slams ACC for withholding trophy; donates match fees to armed forces
description: India skipper Suryakumar Yadav criticised the Asian Cricket Council for denying his team the Asia Cup 2025 trophy despite a hard-fought triumph over Pakistan in the final. Calling his teammates the “real trophies,” he stressed the significance of the win while dismissing concerns over his form. In a heartfelt gesture, Suryakumar announced he would donate his match fees to the Indian armed forces.

Illegal betting: ED may attach assets of celebs
description: The ED is intensifying its probe into the 1xBet online betting platform, considering property attachments for individuals linked to money laundering. Celebrities, including cricketers and filmstars, who endorsed the illegal platform, may be named as accused in the upcoming chargesheet. Some have appeared for questioning, while others face further summonses, indicating a widening investigation into illegal betting activities.

title: Cancer cases in India up by 26%, deaths 21% since 1990
description: Cancer incidence in India surged by 26% since 1990, with deaths up 21%, contrasting sharply with declines in the US and China. This rise is attributed to high tobacco use, obesity, and inadequate early detection. Experts advocate for stronger prevention, expanded screening, and increased tobacco taxes to reverse this alarming trend.

title: PM Modi meets Vice President Radhakrishnan
description: "Hon'ble Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi met with Hon'ble Vice-President Shri C P Radhakrishnan at the Vice-President's Enclave today," the Vice President's secretariat said on X.

title: Man roped in teen son to kill property dealer over 9-yr feud
description: A father-son duo was arrested for the murder of 56-year-old property dealer Lakhpat Singh Kataria in Malviya Nagar, culminating a decade-long vendetta. The 47-year-old father allegedly involved his 17-year-old son, timing the crime a day before his 18th birthday to exploit juvenile laws.

title: EC to deploy 470 officers for Bihar election, bypolls
description: The Election Commission will deploy 470 officers from various civil services as general, police, and expenditure observers for the upcoming Bihar assembly election and bypolls in seven states. These observers will ensure fairness, impartiality, and credibility, acting as the EC's eyes and ears to oversee the electoral process and flag any abuse of money power.

title: UAE remains top destination for Indians' outbound travel
description: Indian nationals' departures reached 30.8 million in 2024, with the UAE leading as the top destination, attracting 7.8 million travelers. Leisure and diaspora visits primarily drove this significant increase, supported by higher disposable incomes and improved air connectivity. The 25-44 age group constituted the largest share of travelers, reflecting a robust post-pandemic recovery.

title: Government aims to integrate Ayurveda into health education curriculum in schools, colleges: Minister
description: Discussions are underway with NCERT and UGC for preparing course modules for the school education and higher education, says Prataprao Jadhav

title: India's strained ties with US won't hit our relations: Russia
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov affirmed the India-Russia economic partnership remains strong, despite India-US tensions. He praised India's "self-respect" and independent foreign policy in securing its energy interests, particularly regarding Russian oil imports. Lavrov highlighted Russia's full respect for India's national interests and confirmed President Putin's December visit for the annual summit.

title: People can witness Chhath divinity if it gets Unesco tag: PM Modi
description: PM Narendra Modi expressed hope for Chhath Puja's UNESCO recognition, envisioning global appreciation for its grandeur and divinity. He linked the festival to economic empowerment, recalling past government support and urging citizens to buy local products. This initiative aims to elevate regional traditions to global platforms and strengthen the grassroots economy.

title: Spirit of 'nation first' paramount for RSS volunteers, says PM Modi
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his 'Mann Ki Baat', hailed RSS's "unprecedented and inspiring" 100-year journey, emphasizing its dedication to nation-building and service since its 1925 founding. He also highlighted Maharishi Valmiki Jayanti, Bhagwan Ram's inclusive ideals, and the new temples for Nishadraj and Valmiki built alongside the Ram temple in Ayodhya.

title: BCCI to lodge protest against Naqvi after Asia Cup trophy presentation fiasco
description: “We came along with the medals, so it is very unfortunate, very unsporting and we hope that the trophy and the medals will be returned to India as soon as possible”, said Devajit Saikia, the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) secretary.

title: Asia Cup | BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia to Pak board chief Mohsin Naqvi: ‘Return trophy and medals as soon as possible’
Durga Puja revellers flock early to pandals in West Bengal fearing rain
description: Durga Puja festivities will peak over the next four days of Saptami, Ashtami, Navami, and Dashami; large crowds were seen in Kolkata, its suburbs, and in the districts across West Bengal on Sasthi, the sixth day of the festival

title: Congress writes to home minister over 'death threat' to Rahul Gandhi
description: Congress general secretary K C Venugopal urged Home Minister Amit Shah for swift action against BJP spokesperson Printu Mahadev over a death threat to Rahul Gandhi. Mahadev allegedly stated, "Rahul Gandhi will be shot in the chest," during a televised debate. Venugopal warned of complicity if no action is taken, citing serious security concerns.

title: Horoscope Today, September 29, 2025: Astrological Insights for Scorpio, Gemini, Capricorn, Libra, and Every Sun Sign

description: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister says the double-engine government has played a significant role in the fight against Maoists in the State; he says tourism is a focus area in Bastar because of its natural beauty, and agriculture and dairy will be promoted because tribal communities have a particular interest in farming; the State has received investment proposals worth ₹7 lakh crore in just 10 months, he adds

title: Making of tragedy: Vijay's late entry, roadshow & payday rush
description: A deadly stampede at a TVK rally in Karur claimed 40 lives, largely due to president Vijay's delayed arrival, which swelled the crowd far beyond the venue's capacity. Congestion worsened as his vehicle moved through the packed area, and darkness from a power disruption triggered chaos, leading to the tragic crush.

title: Going beyond the metaphor ‘young at heart’
description: Cardiovascular diseases, once considered to be primarily an old age-related affliction, are now increasingly affecting the younger generations

description: Once the king of the political chessboard, he can at best hope to be the knight

title: Ladakh's people, traditions under attack, says Rahul Gandhi
description: Rahul Gandhi alleged that Ladakh's people and culture were under attack from the BJP and RSS, demanding the UT's inclusion in the Sixth Schedule. He criticized the government for violence and jailing Sonam Wangchuk, a sentiment echoed by Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge, who condemned the Modi government's handling and Wangchuk's arrest under NSA.

title: A hundred years ago | H.M.S. ‘Colombo’
Rs 355 crore sale marks new high for Indian art market
description: Vasudeo Gaitonde's painting set a new record at Saffronart's 25th anniversary sale, selling for Rs 67.08 crore and making him India's second priciest artist. The auction achieved a record Rs 355.8 crore for South Asian art, showcasing market resilience. Nalini Malani's contemporary work also saw significant success.

title: Zubeen was 'Kohinoor of Assamese culture': PM Modi
description: PM Narendra Modi hailed Zubeen Garg as the "Kohinoor of Assamese culture" during his Mann Ki Baat address, as grief over the music icon's death continued. Modi linked Garg's loss to Bhupen Hazarika's centenary celebrations. Union Minister Nitin Gadkari also cited Garg's life to highlight the supremacy of talent over other privileges.

title: Immigration gets faster with e-arrival cards from October 1
description: India will streamline foreign national arrivals from October 1 by replacing physical disembarkation cards with optional digital e-arrival cards for work, tourism, study, or business visitors. This initiative, alongside the existing Fast Track Immigration - Trusted Traveller Programme for Indian citizens and OCI holders, aims to significantly reduce immigration delays at airports nationwide.

title: Amit Shah rejects Naxals' truce offer, vows menace will end in March
description: Home Minister Amit Shah rejected the CPI(Maoist) ceasefire offer, reaffirming the March 2026 deadline to end armed Naxalism. He stated no ceasefire for security forces, but offered rehabilitation for those who surrender. Shah also criticized civil society elements supporting Maoists, highlighting the Modi government's successful strategy in reducing LWE fatalities.

title: Reimagining green economy through landscapes
description: A shared comprehensive understanding of the landscape needs to be integrated into the green economy transition to assess and improve ecological functions such as air and water quality, habitat support, and climate regulation

title: Asia Cup trophy not awarded to champions India after they refuse to accept it from ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi
description: Once Mohsin Naqvi took the dais, he was informed that Indian team won't accept the trophy if he tries to force himself and an official protest would be lodged.

title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta launches 300 e-buses for trans-Yamuna connectivity
description: Entire public transport fleet to turn electric within next 18 months, says Gupta, inaugurates 6-lane flyover; detailed study under way to expand bus network across Capital, says Transport Minister

The BCCI rewarded the champions with a massive Rs 21 crore prize money, celebrating a significant victory ahead of the T20 World Cup.

Search operation launched after suspected Pakistan drone spotted in J&K’s Samba
description: A search operation was launched in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district after locals reported a suspected Pakistani drone. This incident highlights the persistent threat of cross-border drone activities, frequently used by terrorist outfits to smuggle weapons and narcotics, aiming to revive terrorism in the region. Security forces regularly recover such illicit drops.

title: Two infiltrators killed along LoC
description: Security forces foiled an infiltration attempt along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir’s Kupwara on Sunday, killing two infiltrators in the Keran sector after a gunbattle. A search operation is currently underway. This marks the second such incident this month, following an August 31 encounter in the Gurez sector, highlighting these traditional infiltration routes.

Op Sindoor on games field, outcome is the same: PM as India beats Pak in Asia Cup final
description: India secured a thrilling Asia Cup 2025 triumph over Pakistan, winning by five wickets in Dubai. Prime Minister Modi celebrated the victory with a viral tweet, declaring "#OperationSindoor". Tilak Varma's unbeaten 69 anchored India's chase of 147, while Kuldeep Yadav's 4/30 dismantled Pakistan's batting. This dominant win, marked by intense rivalry, clinched India's record-extending ninth Asia Cup crown.

title: Venezuela Fury and Noah Price: Teen couple’s combined net worth revealed
description: Tyson Fury's 16-year-old daughter, Venezuela Fury, and young boxer Noah Price are engaged, drawing significant public attention. Venezuela, a social media personality, and Noah, a rising amateur boxer, are both building their careers. Despite their famous family connections, their combined personal net worth is estimated to be under $200,000 as they embark on their shared journey.

title: Letters to The Editor — September 29, 2025
Asia Cup | Watch: Gambhir goes crazy, bangs table during IND vs PAK final
description: India clinched their record ninth Asia Cup title, defeating Pakistan in a thrilling final. Tilak Varma's unbeaten 69 anchored India's chase of 147, culminating in a towering six that sealed the victory. Former opener Gautam Gambhir's passionate table-thumping celebration became an iconic moment, reflecting the intensity of the rivalry.

title: Asia Cup: Tilak, Kuldeep help India beat Pakistan, win ninth continental title
description: India clinched the 2025 Asia Cup with a five-wicket win over Pakistan in Dubai on Sunday (September 28). Sahibzada Farhan’s fiery fifty set up Pakistan, but a stunning collapse from 113/1 to 146 all out handed India the edge. Tilak Varma’s gritty 69* and Shivam Dube’s power-hitting ensured India overcame early setbacks to seal another tense India-Pakistan classic.

title: ​An avoidable tragedy: On the TVK rally, the stampede in Karur
description: Police must not allow roadshows in dense locations

title: 2 of 4 protesters killed in Ladakh protest cremated
description: Amid curfew and mobile internet ban, two victims of Ladakh's violent statehood protest were cremated under heavy security, with media barred and a local leader prevented from attending. Congress blamed the Centre and BJP for the crisis, accusing them of abandoning Ladakhis after the Article 370 abrogation, while clarifying Sonam Wangchuk's non-affiliation.

description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has ended his reelection bid, setting up a three-way race for the city's top office between Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo, and Curtis Sliwa. Adams' withdrawal, announced via video, comes amidst low poll numbers and a corruption scandal, though his name will still appear on the November ballot. This significantly alters the mayoral contest.

title: NATO says beefing up Baltic presence after Denmark drone sightings
description: Several NATO countries say Russian fighter jets and drones have violated their airspace in Europe over recent weeks, accusing Moscow of testing the alliance.

Chaos in Katy Texas as 3 Muslim men shoot Little League baseball coach during prayer
description: A 27-year-old baseball coach was struck by a stray bullet during a youth tournament in Katy, Texas, on September 21, 2025. The coach, hit in the shoulder, was airlifted and released in stable condition. Three suspects face deadly conduct charges after shots, believed to be from nearby property, injured the coach.

He likened enjoying idli to experiencing a Beethoven symphony, celebrating South Indian culinary heritage. His poetic post quickly went viral, garnering widespread praise and shared love for the dish.

The combat veteran, reportedly suffering from PTSD, previously escorted Kellie Pickler to the CMAs and claimed friendly fire in Iraq by "LGBTQ White Supremacists."

He urged de-risking through resilient supply chains and diverse production centres. Jaishankar also subtly criticised major powers like the US and China for trade protectionism and tariff volatility, which erode international trust and disproportionately affect the Global South.

Public interest remains high, with polls and betting markets reflecting curiosity about his potential candidacy for 2028 or beyond.

However, defenseman David Reinbacher will miss four weeks. He suffered a metacarpal fracture. This injury complicates the team's defense. The Canadiens now face a mixed outlook for the upcoming season.

Woman diagnosed with aggressive breast cancer, after doctors said it was ‘nothing’
description: A 35-year-old woman, initially dismissed a breast lump, attributing it to hormonal changes. Despite a family history, she was advised against early mammograms. Mammogram is a screening test to detect breast cancer in people with no symptoms and diagnosis to investigate symptoms or abnormalities found during a physical exam. Diagnosed with aggressive breast cancer while pregnant, she bravely underwent treatment to save herself and her baby, emphasizing the danger of ignoring symptoms.

description: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet downplayed concerns about the new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, calling it a "non-issue" for the global consulting giant due to its minimal reliance on such visas. This stance sharply contrasts with Indian IT firms heavily dependent on the program.

title: H-1B visa fees hike: Startup CEO challenges move; claims it will favour tech firms
description: Box CEO Aaron Levie criticizes President Trump's proposed $100,000 H-1B visa fee, arguing it disadvantages startups against big tech companies in the global talent war. He advocates for a lower fee and a broader reform framework, including flexible visa caps and attracting top talent while protecting American wages. Concerns are raised about innovation potentially moving overseas.

title: Ed Sheeran’s Swift–Kelce comment has fans questioning his bond with her
description: Ed Sheeran's confession that he learned of Taylor Swift's engagement to Travis Kelce via Instagram has fueled speculation about a crack in their friendship. Fans are questioning their bond, recalling past instances of perceived disloyalty. Neither has responded, while Swift is reportedly focused on planning her wedding for next summer.
